firmware_notes: MFJ-1278 original (1988-1992), MFJ-1278B (1992+) añade PACTOR y SSTV. MFJ-1278T incluye 2400 baud packet. Compatible con TNC-2. El firmware se expandió de 512K a 1Mbit en versiones posteriores.

Mode Switching.help:
VHF Packet at 1200 baud Bell 202 AFSK.

Default packet mode on power-up.

HF Packet at 300 baud.

Use for HF packet operation.

2400 baud packet mode (MFJ-1278T and 1278B).

TURBO LED lights when active.
Requires 2400 baud modem option.

CW mode. Optional speed in WPM.

Examples:
  MODE CW (default speed)
  MODE CW,20 (20 WPM)

CW speed can be 5-99 WPM.

Baudot RTTY mode.

Optional baud rate parameter.
Common rates: 45, 50, 75

Example: MODE RTY,45

ASCII RTTY mode.

Optional baud rate.
Common rates: 110, 300

Example: MODE ASC,110

AMTOR mode for HF digital communication.

Supports ARQ and FEC modes.

PACTOR mode (MFJ-1278B only).

Advanced HF digital mode with ARQ and compression.
Prompt changes to p_cmd:

Weather FAX reception mode.

Requires MultiCom software for display.
Receives HF weather maps and charts.

Slow Scan TV mode (MFJ-1278B).

Requires MultiCom software.
Supports various SSTV formats.

NAVTEX marine weather and navigation warning reception.

518 kHz and 490 kHz.

Connection.help:
Initiates an AX.25 connection to the specified station.

Examples:
  C DG2GSV
  C DB0UAL VIA DG2GSV
  C DB0FHN VIA DB0UAL,DB0RBS

The TNC sends SABM frames and waits for UA. If no response after RETRY attempts, it gives up.
Sends a DISC frame to end the current AX.25 connection gracefully.

Enters converse mode. Everything you type is transmitted.

Press Ctrl+C to return to cmd: prompt.

Enters transparent mode for binary file transfers.

Data passed without interpretation.

Monitoring.help:
Enables or disables the display of packets on the radio channel.

MON ON  – show monitored traffic
MON OFF – only show data from connected station

Default: ON

Controls whether monitored traffic is shown during active connections.

Default: OFF

When ON, only shows packets from connected stations.

Default: OFF

When ON, monitors all packets including those to other stations.

Default: ON
Displays a list of stations heard recently with timestamps.

When ON, shows digipeated packets.

Default: OFF

When ON, displays packet header on separate line from data.

Default: ON

Station Setup.help:
Sets the callsign used for all transmissions.

Examples:
  MY EA7HQL
  MY EA7HQL-5

SSID (-0 to -15) can be appended. Default SSID is -0.
You MUST set this before connecting.

Sets alternate identifier for digipeating.

Example: MYALIAS MADRID

Stations can digipeat via MYCALL or MYALIAS.

Default: none

Controls whether the TNC echoes back characters you type.

ECHO ON  – TNC echoes input
ECHO OFF – no echo (use if terminal has local echo)

Default: ON

Adds LF after each CR received.

Default: OFF

Enables XON/XOFF software flow control between TNC and terminal.

Default: ON

When ON, displays message when changing modes.

Default: ON

Packet Timing.help:
Delay between keying TX and sending data.

Values: 0-120 (10ms units)
Default: 30 (300ms)

Guidelines:
  Direct VHF: 20-30
  Via repeater: 40-60
  HF: 30-50

Seconds to wait for ACK before retransmitting.

Values: 1-15
Default: 3

Guidelines:
  VHF direct: 3
  Via digipeater: 5-7
  HF: 8-15

Max retransmission attempts before disconnect.

Values: 0-15
Default: 10

CSMA persistence. Higher = more aggressive transmit.

Values: 0-255
Default: 63

Probability = (PERSIST + 1) / 256
  63 = 25% (shared channels)
  255 = always transmit (point-to-point)

Time between PERSIST checks.

Values: 0-255 (10ms units)
Default: 10 (100ms)

Time slots to wait after DCD drops before transmitting.

Values: 0-255
Default: 0

Each slot = SLOTTIME duration.

Time to wait before responding to poll.

Values: 0-250
Default: 0

Packet Advanced.help:
Maximum data bytes per AX.25 I-frame.

Values: 0-255 (0 = 256)
Default: 128

Guidelines:
  HF (300 baud): 40-80
  VHF (1200 baud): 128
  VHF (2400/9600 baud): 255

Smaller = fewer retransmissions on noisy links.

Max unacknowledged I-frames before waiting for ACK.

Values: 1-7
Default: 4

Guidelines:
  HF: 1-2
  VHF simplex: 3-4
  VHF full-duplex: 7

When ON, TNC acts as digipeater for MYCALL and MYALIAS.

Default: OFF

When ON, sends efficient square wave during TXDELAY instead of flags.

Improves efficiency but some older TNCs may not decode.
Turn OFF if remote station can't receive your packets.

Default: ON

ON - use AX.25 v2.0 protocol (poll frames)
OFF - use AX.25 v1.0 protocol

v2.0 uses short poll frames instead of retransmitting full packets.
Recommended ON for VHF/UHF.

Default: ON

Sets packet checksum method:

0 - CRC (default)
1 - Checksum

Default: 0

When ON, passes packets even with CRC errors (for monitoring).

Default: OFF

Beacon & Unproto.help:
Sets beacon transmission:

EVERY n - send beacon every n×10 seconds
AFTER n - send once after n×10 sec of inactivity

Values: 0-250 (0 = off)
Default: 0

Example: BEACON EVERY 90 (send every 15 minutes)

WARNING: Use beacons sparingly! Keep short and infrequent.

Sets the text for beacon packets. Max 120 characters.

Example: BTEXT EA7HQL VHF Packet in Madrid

Default: empty

Sets destination for beacons and unconnected packets.

Examples:
  UNPROTO CQ
  UNPROTO BEACON VIA WIDE2-2
  UNPROTO APRS VIA RELAY,WIDE

Default: CQ

Immediately sends an identification packet.

Useful for sending final ID before shutdown.

When ON, sends ID beacon every 9.5 minutes when digipeating.

Format: W3IWI-3>ID:W3IWI/R

Default: OFF

Connect Messages.help:
Message sent when someone connects to you. Max 120 characters.

Example: CTEXT Welcome to EA7HQL

Default: empty

When ON, displays '*** CONNECTED to {call}' message.

Default: ON

When ON, sounds terminal bell when connection established.

Default: OFF

CW Parameters.help:
Sets the CW sending and receiving speed in words per minute.

Values: 5-99
Default: 20

Common speeds:
  15 – slow, comfortable for beginners
  20 – standard QSO speed
  30+ – contest/advanced

Sets the receive CW filter center frequency.

Values: 200-2000 Hz
Default: 800

Match this to your transceiver's sidetone frequency for best decoding.

CW Parameters.desc: CW ID at end of transmission
CW Parameters.help:
When ON, the TNC sends your callsign in CW at the end of each transmission.

Default: OFF

Adjusts the CW dash-to-dot ratio.

Values: 10-90
Default: 50 (standard 3:1 ratio)

Values >50 produce heavier (longer) dashes.

When ON, generates random CW characters for practice.

Default: OFF

RTTY/ASCII Parameters.help:
Sets the RTTY baud rate.

Common values:
  45 – standard 45.45 baud (amateur HF RTTY)
  50 – commercial RTTY
  75, 100, 110, 150, 200, 300

Default: 45

Sets the frequency shift between mark and space tones.

Common values:
  170 – standard amateur RTTY
  200 – some commercial systems
  425 – older commercial
  850 – wide shift

Default: 170

Inverts the sense of mark and space tones.

Try toggling if you receive garbled text. Some stations use inverted polarity.

Default: OFF

When ON, RTTY automatically shifts to letters after space character.

Default: ON

Automatically insert CR after n characters.

0 = disabled

Default: 0

AMTOR Parameters.help:
Initiates an AMTOR ARQ (Automatic Repeat Request) connection.

The selcall is a 4-character code derived from the target station's callsign.

Example:
  AC DGKV

Sets your 4-character AMTOR selective call.

Derivation: First letter + last 3 letters of callsign.
Example: W0XI → WWXI

Default: none

In AMTOR mode, press Ctrl+C then T to start FEC broadcast.

FEC is a one-way mode – no acknowledgement from the receiving station. Good for CQ calls and broadcasts.
MODE TOR places the TNC in AMTOR standby, listening for incoming ARQ calls addressed to your selcall.

PACTOR (1278B).help:
In PACTOR mode (MODE PT), initiates connection.

Example: C EA7HQL

PACTOR provides compressed ARQ with automatic speed adjustment.

In PACTOR standby, enter converse (K) for FEC broadcast.

One-way transmission for calling CQ.

In PACTOR converse, type + to request speed increase.

Automatic based on link quality.
In PACTOR converse, type - to request speed decrease.

Sets PACTOR callsign (up to 8 characters).

Defaults to MYCALL if not set.

Automatic Signal Analysis.help:
Analyzes incoming signal and determines:
- Mode (RTTY, ASCII, AMTOR, Packet)
- Baud rate
- Shift
- Polarity

TNC automatically configures itself.

Very useful for unknown signals!

After ASA detects 100 baud signal (possible AMTOR), confirms mode.

If not confirmed, TNC switches to 100 baud RTTY.

Mailbox (EasyMail).help:
Max simultaneous mailbox connections.

Values: 0-10
Default: 1

Sets mailbox memory allocation.

Standard: 32K
Expandable to: 128K or 512K

Example: MBSIZE 32K

Dedicated callsign for mailbox operation.

Example: MBEMAIL EA7HQL-7

Allows mailbox to stay on while operating packet.

Greeting message for mailbox users.

Default: empty

When ON, MAIL LED blinks when you have mail.

Default: OFF

KISS Mode.help:
Enables KISS protocol for host programs (TCP/IP, BBS).

After KISS ON, issue RESTART.
CON and STA LEDs blink 3 times to confirm.

Default: OFF

Sets interface protocol:

TERMINAL - normal operation
HOST - binary host mode
KISS - KISS protocol

Default: TERMINAL

Serial Port.help:
Sets RS-232 terminal baud rate.

Values:
0 - autobaud (default)
300, 1200, 2400, 4800, 9600, 19200

Use RESTART after changing.

Sets data bits for serial port.

Values: 7, 8
Default: 8

Sets serial port parity.

Default: NONE

Display.help:
Shows TNC parameter values.

No parameter - all settings
With parameter - single setting

Examples:
  DISP
  DISP PACLEN
  DISP TXDELAY
Displays current connection status and link information.
Displays firmware version and build date.

Calibration.help:
Enters calibration mode for adjusting transmitter audio levels.

The TNC transmits alternating tones.
Use 20-segment tuning indicator for adjustment.

Press any key to exit.

Sets RTTY mark tone frequency.

Values: 1000-3000 Hz
Default: 2125

Sets RTTY space tone frequency.

Values: 1000-3000 Hz
Default: 2295

Special Features.help:
Sets internal real-time clock.

Format: YY=year, MM=month, DD=day, HH=hour, MM=minute, SS=second

Example: DAYTIME 250214173000

When ON, adds timestamp to monitored packets.

Default: OFF

When ON, timestamps each monitored packet.

Default: OFF

When ON, displays AX.25 protocol information in monitored packets.

Default: OFF

Reset.help:
Resets ALL parameters to factory defaults.

WARNING: Erases callsign and all settings.

Use PERM to save settings before RESET if needed.

Restarts TNC without clearing parameters.

Required after changing some parameters like KISS, baud rate.

Saves current parameters to EEPROM for power-on.

Without PERM, changes are lost at power-off.

Special Keys.help: Sends Ctrl+C (0x03) to return to the cmd: prompt from converse or data mode.
Sends ESC (0x1B). Used for special functions.
Sends a serial BREAK signal. Used for autobaud detection or hardware reset.

connectors.Computer Port (RS-232): DB-25 male (DTE). Pin 2: TxD (in from computer), Pin 3: RxD (out to computer), Pin 4: RTS (in), Pin 5: CTS (out), Pin 6: DSR (out), Pin 7: GND, Pin 8: DCD (out), Pin 20: DTR (in). Standard RS-232C/EIA-232.
connectors.Computer Port (TTL): 8-pin IDC header. Alternative to RS-232 for direct TTL connection. Pin 1: GND, Pin 2: TxD (out), Pin 3: RxD (in), Pin 4: RTS (in), Pin 5: CTS (out), Pin 6: +5V, Pin 7: DCD (out), Pin 8: DTR (in).
connectors.Radio Port 1: 5-pin DIN female (VHF). Pin 1: RX audio in (10K impedance), Pin 2: GND, Pin 3: PTT (out, active low), Pin 4: TX audio out (AFSK, adjustable 10mV-3V p-p), Pin 5: GND.
connectors.Radio Port 2: 5-pin DIN female (HF). Same pinout as Radio Port 1.
connectors.CW Key Outputs: Two RCA jacks. DIRECT - solid-state keying (positive). GRID BLOCK - tube rig keying (negative, -150V max).
connectors.FSK Output: 8-pin IDC TTL header. Pin 1: +5V, Pin 2: Mark out, Pin 3: GND, Pin 4: Space out, Pin 5-7: NC, Pin 8: FSK composite (mark=high, space=low).
connectors.Paddle Input: 1/4" stereo jack. Tip: Dot, Ring: Dash, Sleeve: GND. For iambic keyer operation.
connectors.Printer Port: DB-25 female. Standard Centronics-compatible parallel printer port for printing received text, FAX, and SSTV.
connectors.Speaker Output: 3.5mm mono jack (rear panel). Monitor output only, NOT an input. Adjustable volume.
connectors.Power: 2.1mm coaxial jack, center positive. +12V DC (11-16V acceptable), 500mA typical, 1A max.

notes.tuning_indicator: 20-segment, 10 Hz precision tuning indicator. Center LED segments (MARK/SPACE) should blink alternately when properly tuned. Provides uniform tuning for all modes.
notes.modems: VHF: 1200 baud Bell 202 AFSK. HF: 300 baud. Optional 2400 baud (1278T/1278B). Optional 9600 baud G3RUH modem.
notes.tnc2_compatible: MFJ-1278 is TNC-2 compatible. Uses standard TNC-2 command set with MFJ enhancements.
notes.multicom_software: MFJ MultiCom software (MFJ-1289) provides graphics capabilities for FAX and SSTV. Supports color SSTV on VGA systems.
notes.memory_expansion: Mailbox memory expandable from 32K to 128K or 512K by replacing IC. No other controller offers this.
notes.pactor_mailbox: 1278B includes PACTOR mailbox with auto-forwarding, reverse forwarding, remote sysop, chat mode.
notes.firmware_updates: EPROM firmware. Original 512K, expanded to 1Mbit in later versions. Check MFJ for updates.
notes.asa_feature: ASA (Automatic Signal Analysis) unique to MFJ. Automatically determines mode, baud, shift, polarity of unknown signals.
